ratings.comment: I have him for MATH 240 right now. He's a good lecturer, he gives a lot of extra practice for studying, and the exams are easy, but he and his TA's are not good graders. If you don't get the entire question right, then you don't get any points for the question. It sucks, but it makes sense since MATH 240 is a proof-based course, so I can't complain

I really loved my time with Professor Keller in number theory! Classes really encouraged group collaboration, and he was very accessible during office hours for help with the more challenging content. Also very flexible with deadlines! Would take again.

Mitch is a good instructor. However, his grading system is unique. To achieve an A, students must either secure full marks on all assignments and tests or gain extra credit. Without meeting these criteria, the highest possible grade is an AB.

I took calc in high school and struggled, but Dr. Keller is amazing at explaining math concepts and finally made me actually understand calculus. Lectures aren't mandatory, but I would recommend going since ta's will be there if you have questions about in-class problems. As long as you do the homework and discussion problems, you'll be fine!

Professor Keller did a great job of explaining concepts in a clear and engaging way. By giving students time to try problems in class as well as ask questions, he creates a good learning environment. This course is very test heavy (similar to all math courses) so I would recommend that students attend lectures, discussions, and do test prep.

I think he does a good job explaining tougher topics. BUT if you are a person that likes to go to office hours do not go to his. He is not very approachable during office hours and it seems like he couldn't be bothered to help most of the time. Lectures are also recorded so attendance is not necessary.

Professor Keller is great. All his word problems are about "Bob the Iguana," except for one problem, which was about zombies coming for your brain. He read it in a zombie voice to the class, which I respect. Best of all is Dr. Keller's stellar use of canvas. He makes learning math doable for any student that puts in the time and effort.

Tests are literally 85% of your grade. So unfair. If you like a good gpa and aren't a good test taker (like so many people are) DO NOT take this class!!!! Prof isn't the most approachable, and it is impossible to get a good grade in the class if you do poorly on just one exam. Frustrating isn't even the word to describe this class, and professor.
Does not do the best job thoroughly explaining math concepts.
